{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.16719v1", "title": "Higher-order photon rings of an ultracompact object and their
  interferometric pattern", "summary": "A horizonless ultracompact object can have a stable antiphoton sphere, which
causes the strong deflection of photons inside the unstable photon sphere,
leading to the formation of distinctive inner photon rings. In this work, we
present analytical descriptions for the shape, thickness and interference
pattern of higher-order inner photon rings. By taking the static spherically
symmetric Schwarzschild star with a photon sphere as an example, we find that
its inner photon rings can be more non-circular and thicker than the outer
ones, and show that the inclusion of the inner photon rings can give rise to
new features in the interferometric pattern. Our formulae can also be applied
to other ultracompact objects, providing a convenient way to study the
observational properties of their higher-order photon rings.", "main_category": "gr-qc", "categories": "gr-qc", "published": "2025-04-23T13:49:44Z"}
